result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference at 05-27-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 06-15-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant appeared in custody in person from Trempealeau County Jail with counsel SPD Carly Sebion present.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  State called 1st witness Deputy T. G, sworn, and testifies.  Exhibit 1 marked - Non-consent form by C.G.;  Offered and received.  Exhibit 2 marked - Voluntary Statement by C.G.; Offered and Received.  Witness ID's defendant; Record reflects ID.  Exhibit 3 marked - CCAP printout of felony on defendant; Offered and received.  Attorney Sebion questions witness.  Re-direct by State.  Follow-up questions of witness by defense.  No further evidence by the State and moves for bind over.  No witnesses called by defense.  Defense moves for dismissal or reduction of burglary to a lower charge.  Court orders there is sufficient evidence for a bind over.  Information filed.  Proceeded to arraignment.  Charges and penalties reviewed as listed in Information.  Defense enters not guilty pleas on all counts.  Court enters not guilty pleas and sets pretrial and status dates.  Bond continued.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant has received complaint.  The Court reviews charges/penalties and defendant understands.  Defendant states she called the SPDO this morning and she qualifies.  The State requests a $5000 signature bond with conditions.  Courts orders bond as requested.
